resources.string: Many thanks to all unlisted contributors for contributing code, translations, support, ideas, motivation, bug reports, money… ✊

João Paulo Barraca (HPlus)
Vitaly Svyastyn (NO.1 F1)
Sami Alaoui (Teclast H30)
"ladbsoft" (XWatch)
Sebastian Kranz (ZeTime)
Vadim Kaushan (ID115)
"maxirnilian" (Lenovo Watch 9)
"ksiwczynski", "mkusnierz", "mamutcho" (Lenovo Watch X Plus)
Andreas Böhler (Casio GB-6900B, Casio GB-5600B, Casio GBX-100)
Jean-François Greffier (Mi Scale 2)
Johannes Schmitt (BFH-16)
Lukas Schwichtenberg (Makibes HR3)
Daniel Dakhno (Fossil Q Hybrid, Fossil Hybrid HR)
Gordon Williams (Bangle.js)
Pavel Elagin (JYou Y5)
Taavi Eomäe (iTag)
Johannes Krude(Casio GW-B5600)
Core Team (in order of first code contribution)

Android companion app for Bangle.js built on top of the Gadgetbridge project, with added Internet Access.\n\nDue to Google Play Store policies, we are not allowed a donation link in the app itself, but if you like this app please consider donating via the Gadgetbridge homepage below.

Android companion app for Bangle.js built on top of the Gadgetbridge project, with added Internet Access.\n\nDue to Google Play Store policies, we are not allowed a donation link in the app itself, but if you like this app please consider donating via the Gadgetbridge homepage below.
Cloudless copylefted libre replacement for closed source Android gadget apps from vendors.

Cloudless copylefted libre replacement for closed source Android gadget apps from vendors. Nightly releases of Gadgetbridge. It cannot be installed if you already have either the Gadgetbridge or the Pebble app installed, due to a conflict in the Pebble provider.

Cloudless copylefted libre replacement for closed source Android gadget apps from vendors. Nightly releases of Gadgetbridge. This version has the Pebble provider renamed to prevent conflicts, so some Pebble related integrations will not work, but it can be installed alongside existing Gadgetbridge installation.
Really delete files in the Export/Import directory?
Delete files in the Export/Import directory?
Location could not be understood. Likely an issue of newer Android permission system. Most likely, autoexport is not working now.
AutoExport has not been not scheduled.

The import/export operations allows you to migrate or backup all Gadgetbridge settings, devices and data to and from a zip file.\n\nImporting a file will remove all existing data, devices, and preferences, completely replacing them with the backup.

Exported files in the Export/Import directory are accessible by any app on your device. You might like to remove these files after synchronisation or backup. Make sure to have a backup before deleting them. GPX files, sub-directories and auto-exported database file (if exist) will not be deleted. The path to the Export/Import directory is:
Warning! By pushing this button you will wipe your database and start from scratch.

The export/import operations use the following path (see below) to a directory on your device. This directory is accessible to other Android apps and your computer. Do note, that this directory and all containing files are deleted if you uninstall Gadgetbridge. The data includes:
 Export_preference - global settings
 Export_preference_MAC - device specific settings
 Gadgetbridge - device and activity database
 Gadgetbridge_date - database exported on a date
 *.gpx - GPS recordings
 *.log - log files
Expect to find your exported files (or place the files you want to import) there:
To view activity trace, install app which can handle GPX files.
To share this screenshot, install an app which can handle image files.
Daily target: active time in minutes
Minimal steps per minute to detect activity
Minimal steps per minute to detect run
Daily target: fat burn time in minutes
Daily target: standing time in minutes
Allow controlling Bluetooth connection via Intent API
Alarm slot has been set to default
Use the Android Bluetooth pairing dialog to pair the device.

You are about to install the following app:

%1$s
Version %2$s by %3$s
This device requires an authentication key for pairing.
Authentication failed, please check auth key
Wait for device scan instead of blind connection attempts
Proactively try to connect to device periodically
Establish a connection when connection is initiated by device, like headphones
Abort the export? The partial zip file will be deleted.
Abort the import? This may lead to a corrupted or inconsistent database.
%s Please keep this screen open until the operation finishes.
When enabled, the battery can be charged while discharging
Failed to start the battery polling
Choose the shortcuts on the band screen
No paired devices found\n\nTap "Pair New Device" to add a device

resources.string: There should be at least one canned reply.
Cannot upload watchface, too many watchfaces installed
Do some activity and synchronize device.
There should be at least one item selected.
Lowest heart rate: %1$d \nHighest heart rate: %2$d \nMovement intensity: %3$s
Show excess / lack of sleep in weekly and monthly charts
Show excess / lack of steps in weekly and monthly charts
You can only compare two items at a time.
Clap hands to turn up screen
Clapping again will turn off the screen
Pair this device as companion?.\n\nThis is recommended for some functions such as find device, and provides a better connection.
Prevent issues on old Android versions, but might introduce race conditions
Reduce Bluetooth priority and data rate connection parameters.
Are you sure you want to delete "%1$s"?
The device has no free slots for contacts (total slots: %1$s)
This will delete the device and all associated data!
Are you sure you want to power off the device?
Long press the card to disconnect
Taking a screenshot of the device
Really delete the old activity database? Activity data that was not imported will be lost.
Error erasing files from export directory %1$s
Really export data? Previously exported activity data (if any) and preferences will be overwritten.
Really overwrite the current data? All your current activity data (if any), devices, and preferences will be overwritten.
Really delete the entire database? All your activity data and information about your devices will be lost.
Cannot access export path. Please contact the developers.
This will reset the device preferences for all connected devices. Are you sure?
Doing a factory reset will delete all data from the connected device (if supported). Xiaomi/Huami devices also change Bluetooth MAC address, so they appear as a new devices to Gadgetbridge.
Choose what activity details are displayed on device card
DeviceCommunicationService executes the additional DeviceSupport.connect() calls in parallel
DeviceCommunicationService calls DeviceSupport.dispose() a second time
Reuse DeviceSupport instance when reconnecting the gadget.
After being scanned, the device will stick as scanned and ignored for the specified amount of time
After being scanned, the device has to be unseen for this amount of time before being registered again
The minimum RSSI threshold for detection
Vivitar HR & BP Monitor Activity Tracker

Enabling this option will display all discovered Bluetooth devices when scanning. Short tap will copy device name and mac address to clipboard. Long press will launch `Add test device` dialog. Can cause potential app freezing issues.

Make your device discoverable. Currently connected devices will likely not be discovered. Activate location (e.g. GPS) on Android 6+. Disable Privacy Guard for Gadgetbridge, because it may crash and reboot your phone. If no device is found after a few minutes, try again after rebooting your mobile device.
The secret auth key you entered is invalid! Long press on the device to edit.
This device needs a secret auth key, long press on the device to enter it. Read the wiki.
Select Pair to pair your devices. If this fails, try again without pairing.
Only if activate display upon lift enabled
Allow connecting headphones to two devices simultaneously
Google Fast Pair offers instant and seamless device pairing.\nLE Audio provides improved sound quality, lower power consumption, and support for multiple audio streams.

LDAC is a high-resolution codec for superior sound quality.
aptX ensures low latency and high-fidelity audio streaming.
aptX Adaptive adjusts bitrate dynamically based on content and connection.
aptX Adaptive Lossless delivers lossless audio for high-resolution music.
Stable Connection minimizes sound stuttering or skipping.

1) Once you've updated the name, place the earbuds in the charging case, close the lid, and wait for about 10 seconds.

2) In your device settings, remove the original device.

3) Open the charging case again, search for the device, and the name change should be applied successfully.
Connect to two Bluetooth devices simultaneously. For a stable signal, avoid using Dual Device Connection and LDAP mode at the same time.
This option plays a loud sound through the headphones to help locate them. Avoid wearing the headphones to prevent potential hearing damage.
When enabled, In-Ear detection automatically resumes audio when the earbuds are worn and pauses playback when they are removed.
Low latency mode reduces audio lag by utilizing a smaller buffer, though this can sometimes result in a less stable connection.
When using the headphone microphone, it can either automatically switch between the left and right earbud or remain fixed on one side based on your preference.
After applying this setting, your device will restart. Once it powers back on, navigate to the "Devices" screen and reconnect.
Enter desired words, new line for each
Notifications for calls, messages and more
Vibrations for calls, messages, notifications and more

resources.string: Starting the background service failed because of an exception - click here for more information.\n\nError:
Starting the background service failed because…
Error creating directory for log files: %1$s
Location must be turned on to scan for devices
Bluetooth connection access must be granted and enabled for scanning to work properly
Bluetooth scan access must be granted and enabled for scanning to work properly
Location access must be granted and enabled for scanning to work properly
CAUTION: Error when checking version information! You should not continue! Saw version name "%s"
At least one of the words
Companion pairing is required for find phone. Click here for more information.

YOU ARE TRYING TO INSTALL A FIRMWARE, PROCEED AT YOUR OWN RISK.


 This firmware is for HW Revision: %s
Upload is in progress\n%1$d%% at %2$.2fkbps (average %3$.2fkbps)\nPart %4$d of %5$d
To get started, add your first device directly from this screen, restore a backup or start with a clean database.
Break free from the proprietary apps and cloud services of gadget vendors.

Gadgetbridge is an open source app. It is developed by the community, for the community.

Anyone is welcome to contribute via code, documentation, testing and donations.

Gadgetbridge contains no ads and no tracking. It keeps your data locally on your Android device, so it is 100% privacy friendly.

Visit our website for more information, documentation and links to our communication channels.
The dashboard allows you to get a quick idea of how you\'re doing today. The calendar view shows the status of your goals over a whole month.
Gadgetbridge has two main views, each with their own purpose.
The devices view shows all devices you have configured and their status, and gives access to device specific functions such as detailed charts, settings, apps and alarms.
Gadgetbridge needs a lot of permissions to perform all its functions. Review the permissions and their purposes below.
Not granting a permission might cause issues. You can open this screen again from the Settings screen.

Some buttons cannot be configured because their functions are hard-coded in the watch firmware.\n\nWarning: long-pressing the upper button when a watchface from the official Fossil app is installed will also toggle between showing/hiding widgets.
The actions configured here will appear in the Commute app on your watch. Read the wiki for information on how to handle the intents produced by these actions.
Connection not confirmed on watch, using unauthenticated mode
Navigation started but navigationApp not installed on watch. Please install it from the App Manager.
Navigation app not installed on watch
Some functions are disabled because the firmware of the watch is too new
Start the FTP server on the watch
Stop the FTP server on the watch
Control the FTP server on the watch

For optimal results rest for a while before starting a test and keep still during the test. \n Fasten the device tightly, with the screen facing up and the sensor in direct contact with your skin.

string.name: mtrl_picker_navigate_to_current_year_description

string.description: a11y string that informs the user that tapping this button will switch the year [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_navigate_to_year_description

string.description: Notifies the user that the entered date is outside the allowed range [CHAR_LIMIT=36]
string.name: mtrl_picker_out_of_range

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range where end date has been selected [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_end_selected

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range where start date has been selected [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_only_start_selected

string.description: Two dates separated by a dash representing a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_selected

string.description: Indicates that the user must take the action of picking dates within the calendar to form a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_title

string.description: Placeholders for two dates separated by a dash representing a range [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_range_header_unselected

string.description: Confirms the selection [CHAR_LIMIT=12]
string.name: mtrl_picker_save

string.description: a11y string that informs the user that the focused day is the start of a range [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_start_date_description

string.description: Label for a single date selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_hint

string.description: Label for the end date in a range selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_range_end_hint

string.description: Label for the start date in a range selected by the user [CHAR_LIMIT=60]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_date_range_start_hint

string.description: A 1 character abbreviation for day. It will be part of a string such as dd/mm/yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy or y.mm.dd. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_day_abbr

string.description: A 1 character abbreviation for month. It will be part of a string such as dd/mm/yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy or y.mm.dd. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_month_abbr

string.description: A 1 character abbreviation for year. It will be part of a string such as dd/mm/yyyy or mm/dd/yyyy or y.mm.dd. [CHAR_LIMIT=2]
string.name: mtrl_picker_text_input_year_abbr

string.description: a11y string that informs the user that the focused day is today [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_today_description

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button changes the input mode to a calendar [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_calendar_input_mode

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button switches the user to choosing a day [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_day_selection

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button changes the input mode to a text field [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_text_input_mode

string.description: a11y string to indicate this button switches the user to choosing a year [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggle_to_year_selection

string.description: a11y string to indicate this view switched the user to choosing a day [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggled_to_day_selection

string.description: a11y string to indicate this view switched the user to choosing a year [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: mtrl_picker_toggled_to_year_selection

string.description: Button text to indicate that the widget will ignore the user's selection [CHAR_LIMIT=16]
string.name: mtrl_timepicker_cancel

string.description: Button text to indicate that the widget will save the user's selection [CHAR_LIMIT=16]
string.name: mtrl_timepicker_confirm

resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete "%1$s"?
Are you sure you want to delete "%1$d" songs?
Limit for selecting more than one item reached

You are about to upload the following music file:

%1$s
Song title: %2$s
Album: %3$s

resources.string: Play/pause the music depending if you wear the earbuds
Export database failed! Please check your settings.
Export zip failed! Please check your settings.
Select applications and press Upload to device. Any previously uploaded icons may be replaced. Current device limitations unknown.
Select at least one app to upload
The icons will be uploaded in the background. You can close this activity
Are you sure you want to upload %1$d app icons?
The limit for uploading app icons has been reached.
Please connect ONLY ONE device you want to send the file to.
Please connect AT LEAST ONE device you want to send the file to.
Make sure that the device %s is connected

Since we may not distribute the firmware files, you will have to get the files yourself. This means that you will need to search for the files in apk files, online, in forums, on Amazfitwatchfaces (for Miband/Amazfit devices) and so on.

The Firmware/Watchface/App/File Installer allows you to upload/install supported files (firmware, watchfaces, applications, GPS, resources, fonts…) to the device. See some more information in the wiki: https://codeberg.org/Freeyourgadget/Gadgetbridge/wiki/Firmware-Update
Select a file you want to upload to device: %s
This feature has the potential to brick your device. That said, this has never happened to any of the developers through flashing, but remember that you are doing this at your own risk.
Please allow bonding process a few moments to complete.
Several pairing dialogs will pop up on your Android device. If not, look in the notification drawer and accept the pairing request. Both the left and right lens will need to be paired.
Failed to find both the right and left lens. Please scan again.
%1$s lens selected for pairing. Multiple candidates for the %2$s lens found. Please select the %2$s lens from the list below.
Unable to install the given firmware: It doesn\'t match your Pebble\'s hardware revision.
Unable to install the given file: %1$s
A pairing dialog will pop up on your Android device. If not, look in the notification drawer and accept the pairing request. Also accept it on your Pebble afterwards.
Scanning for Bluetooth devices in the background and sending the location to certain gadgets
Allows running in the background unhindered by Android\'s battery optimizations

%1$s needs permission to display over other apps in order to let Bangle.js watches start activities via intents when %1$s is in the background.

This can be used to start a music app and play a song, and many other things.

Please tap "%2$s" then "%1$s" and enable "Allow display over other apps", then tap "Back" to return to %1$s.

To stop %1$s asking for permissions go to "Settings" and uncheck "Check permission status".

Make sure to grant %1$s the permissions needed to function as you expect.
Used by Bangle.js for starting apps and other functionality on your phone
Using images, ringtones, app files and more
All these permissions are required and instability might occur if not granted

%1$s needs access to your location in the background to allow it to stay connected to your watch even when your screen is off.\n\nPlease choose "%2$s" in the following screen, then tap "Back" to return to %1$s.

%1$s needs access to Notifications in order to display them on your watch when your phone\'s screen is off.\n\nPlease tap "%2$s" then "%1$s" and enable "Allow Notification Access", then tap "Back" to return to %1$s.

%1$s needs access to Do Not Disturb settings in order to honour them on your watch when your phone\'s screen is off.\n\nPlease tap "%2$s" then "%1$s" and enable "Allow Do Not Disturb", then tap "Back" to return to %1$s.
Posting ongoing notification which keeps the service running
Reading the number of an outgoing call to display it on a gadget
Reading names and icons of all installed apps

%1$s allows you to send messages and other data from Android to your device. To do this it requires permission to access that data and without it, it might not function properly.

You'll now be presented with a few Android dialogs requesting those permissions.

Please tap "%2$s" to continue.
The screen will turn off after the microphone has detected silence for a while
Override the audio buffer to fix audio stutter
Automatically enable standby mode when the selected device is not connected to the phone. Enable this if the USB port in your car has power when the car is off.
Automatically open Android Auto when connected, skipping the manual screen prompt. Might not work on all cars.
Allow media playback through a different Bluetooth device
Allow speech instructions to through a different Bluetooth device
After toggling dongle mode, you will need to pair the device again. Please wait at least 30 seconds for the setting to be applied.
Use the native dongle logic for Android Auto. This may help with Bluetooth hands-free connectivity issues. When enabled, manual phone switching is not possible.
Set to 0 to use the car\'s default value
Pass data directly, without any processing
Allow over 6 taps in succession. May impact GPS accuracy.
Workaround - enable this if the LED is solid blue, but Android Auto is not starting
Fix crash on VAG Technisat units during song skip/pause. Do not enable on other cars, may cause glitches.
Trigger a full sync of all activity data
This will trigger a full sync of all activity data from the device. It may take a few minutes to complete.
Set the strength of the ANC automatically depending on the ambient sound level
Increase volume automatically when ambient sound is loud
Disable this if only using BLE to save power
Fetch happens upon screen unlock. Only works if a lock mechanism is set!
Number of seconds after which the call is automatically picked up
The phone will automatically pick-up incoming phonecalls
This is best-effort, and might be delayed for several reasons
Blacklisted calendars will not be synced to the device
Weather information will be cached across application restarts.
Amount of calendar events to synchronize
Target app on watch for calendar events
Which action is taken when an incoming call is rejected from the watch
Allows the watch to trigger the phone\'s camera
How many sleep session lines to show before scrolling them
Charts range is set to a Week
Charts range is set to a Month

Check and ask for missing permissions even when they might not be instantly needed. Disable this only if your devices actually doesn\'t support any of these features. Not granting a permission might cause issues!
When the app crashes, display a notification with the error
Combine activity data from all added devices for the totals on the dashboard
Draw cards around the widgets on the dashboard
Show the dashboard when Gadgetbridge starts, instead of the devices screen
Combine activity data from specific devices for the totals on the dashboard
Allow the widget to take up two columns on the dashboard
Show a legend below the widget explaining the colors
Show the activity in a single 24h circle instead of a double 12h circle
The amount of minutes the chart shows "worn" after each successful heart rate measurement
Show an indicator at the current time, to visually separate data from yesterday and today
In 24h mode, draw midnight at the bottom, midday at the top of the chart
Show data from yesterday dimmed between the current time and midnight
Select which widgets are enabled and in what order they are displayed on the dashboard
Send media control commands as key events instead of the media controller.
Date of birth, gender, height, weight, goals
Settings that will be removed in a future version
Populate the database with dummy test activities
Disable find my phone when do not disturb is active
Visible only if no device is added
Display phone number or name for incoming calls
Enable the display the whole day. Disable to select specific times below
Enable the display on the ring
When DND is enabled or disabled on the phone, automatically toggle it on the device too
Do not disturb when not wearing
Enable accepting calls from the device
Enable rejecting calls from the device
Allow rejecting calls with an SMS reply
This will enable access to all available settings, even if unsupported by the device. This can cause instability and crashes on the device.
Changes how high the wearer needs to lift their head for the dashboard to be shown
Zeroes the angle of the glasses, look straight ahead and tap here
Changes the binocular separation and apparent depth of the display
Changes the vertical location of the display
Some devices require a special pairing key for the very first initialization of the device. Tap here for more details in the wiki.
If you get "Update the app to latest version" message on the band, make sure to check the "New Auth Protocol" above. Tap here for more details in the wiki.
Fetch unknown activity files from the watch. They will not be processed, but will be saved in the phone.
You may try forcing the connection type in case your device does not respond to Gadgetbridge
Force Do Not Disturb support.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK
Force enable heart rate support.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK
Force enable SpO2 support.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK
Some devices falsely claim not to have support for some options. This settings can be used to enable them anyway.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK\nRead the wiki
Force smart alarms support.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK
Force wear location support.\nUSE AT YOUR OWN RISK

The list below contains all URLs requested by the watch for AGPS updates. You can select a file from the phone\'s storage that will be sent to the watch when it requests an update.\n\nOnly one of the files needs to be configured.
Fixes some functions such as weather and AGPS updates without connecting to the official app every 90 days.
Do not enable this if you plan to use the official app or connect the watch to the internet. After enabling this setting, you may need to factory reset the watch to authenticate again.
The following functionalities have been deprecated and will be removed soon from the software.\nIf you need to enable one of the following settings be sure to get in touch with the project team.
Real-time automatic heart rate measuring mode
If enabled, uses real-time mode, otherwise uses smart mode. This mode consume more power.
Truncate the fetch operation timestamps to minutes. Disable this setting to keep the timestamps in seconds, if you face issues while fetching very short workouts.
Get a reminder when you complete rings
Get reminders about Activity Ring progress
Get a reminder to get up if you haven\'t gotten up in 1 hour
Manually import activity files from the phone storage
Please enter a frequency between 87.5 and 108.0
List of categories to display every morning
Enable this if some information is not being fetched. Experimental and potentially unstable.
Upload notification app icons to device
Enable/disable specific device features. This can cause issues and/or make your device work incorrectly
1. Tap the button below to start the pairing process.
2. Go to your phone\'s Bluetooth settings, and pair with the new device that will show up (similar name to your current watch, but with a suffix, eg. "Amazfit GTR 4 - AFC8".
In order to receive Bluetooth calls, you need to pair your phone with a second instance of the watch.
WARNING: If you enable Bluetooth calls without pairing with the second instance, call notifications might not work as expected.
Click here to start the pairing process
Swipe down to fetch new data from connected devices.
Lengthens or shortens the lines Right-To-Left text is separated into
Adjust screen brightness according to ambient light
Configure the vibration patterns for different notifications
Display the changelog since last version after Gadgetbridge is updated
Send a reminder and enter sleep mode at bedtime. At the scheduled wake-up time, the wake-up alarm will sound.
Show the Sleep Screen when waking the screen during sleep mode, to reduce distractions
Enable the sleep mode automatically when wearing the band during sleep
Select device as Sleep As Android data provider
Support differs from device to device
Which alarm slot to use when setting alarms
Notifications will be read aloud through the headphones
Playback volume of other applications will be lowered while the notification is spoken
Playback from other applications will be paused while the notification is spoken
Increases transfer speed, but might not work on some Android devices.
Change the auth key to a common key on all your Android devices from which you would like to connect from. The previous default key for all devices is 0123456789@ABCDE
Notifications are automatically removed from the device when dismissed from the phone
Use the gps data of the phone to overwrite the gps data of the bangle device
Use only the network provider to determine the location. This reduces the power consumption at the cost of accuracy. A reconnection is needed.
The interval for how often the gps position is being updated, in ms
If a word cannot be rendered with the watch\'s font, render it to a bitmap in Gadgetbridge and display the bitmap on the watch
Size to use for bitmap text rendering
If you want a custom app loader put your https://…/android.html URL here. Otherwise leave blank for https://banglejs.com/apps
Prevent screenshots and viewing on non-secure displays. Requires a GB restart to become fully effective.
Switch between main screens only using horizontal swiping
Switch between main screens using the navigation bar or horizontal swiping
Sync up to %1s days of calendar events
Dismiss calls from the watch with an SMS message
Send the messages configured below to your device
Reply from the watch using preset messages
Alert (vibrate/beep) for notifications in the "other" category
Makes the device discoverable via Bluetooth even when connected
Enable this to support contextual Arabic
Show a device specific Android notification icon instead the Gadgetbridge icon when connected
Interval in seconds when the current cycling data should be written to the database
Sync time to Gadgetbridge device(s) when connecting, when time or time zone changes on Android device, and periodically
Send a debug request to Huawei device
Settings and functionality used by developers

Allow Bangle.js watch apps to send Android Intents, and allow other apps on Android (like Tasker) to send data to Bangle.js with the com.banglejs.uart.tx Intent. Needs permission to display over other apps to work in the background.
Allow apps on this device to access the internet
Force auto synchronize time on reconnect. Analog hands may show incorrect time!
Check this option if your device cannot be found during discovery
If not ACKed to the band, activity data is not cleared. Useful if GB is used together with other apps.
Send calendar events to the timeline
Disabling this will also stop the Pebble 2/LE to vibrate on outgoing calls
Enable experimental support for Android apps using PebbleKit
Allows other apps to access HR data in realtime while Gadgetbridge is connected
Useful if you your watch has dark hands
Whether the navigation app should automatically come to the foreground when it receives a navigation instruction
Whether the watch should vibrate on every new or changed navigation instruction (only when the app is in the foreground)
Appended in addition to the suffix set in Gadgetbridge
Reconnect only to connected devices, instead of reconnecting to all devices
Enable if your device no longer connects after a firmware upgrade
Huawei account used in pairing process. Setting it allows to pair without factory reset.
Will keep activity data on the device even after synchronization. Useful if GB is used together with other apps. This may cause the watch to run out of space and/or stop syncing properly.
Try to get the current location at runtime, use the stored location as fallback
This might help on devices where firmware flashing fails.
Enable if device media control is not working for certain applications
The icon in the status bar and the notification in the lockscreen are shown
The icon in the status bar and the notification in the lockscreen are hidden
Forward instructions from navigation apps to the watch
Send missed notifications when a device reconnects after being out of range
Delay before sending incoming call notifications to the device, in seconds.
Block all notifications when Do Not Disturb is enabled on the phone
Process media notifications before the app list. If this preference is unchecked, media applications need to be allowed in the application list for media controls to work on the device.
If available, send the long notification text to the device
Only send notifications between specific times
Wake and unlock the Android device when the gadget sends a OPEN response back. Needs to be in a trusted state.
Do not send low and minimum priority notifications to the watch
Do not send notifications from apps in the work profile to the watch
Support for apps that send notifications to the Pebble via PebbleKit.
Used for starting/stopping GPS track recording in external fitness app.
Used for selecting the version of OsmAnd to connect to
When connecting to the band, overwrite all the settings on it.
Will cause messages that are sent to external 3rd party apps to be acknowledged always and immediately
Will cause logs from watch apps to be logged by Gadgetbridge (requires reconnect)
When enabled, allows watchfaces to show weather, battery info etc.
Use experimental Pebble LE support for all Pebbles, instead of BT classic. This requires pairing to non LE first, and then Pebble LE
This option forces using the latest notification protocol depending on the firmware version. KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
Enable untested features. KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!
This is for Pebble 2 only and experimental, try this if you have connectivity problems
Stores the data "as is", increasing the database usage to allow for later interpretation.
If your Pebble 2/Pebble LE does not work as expected, try this setting to limit the MTU (valid range 20 – 512)
Configure the functionality of the physical buttons on the watch
Prefix notification title with name of source application
Shows a preview of the message in the title of a notification as allowed by the device
Perform and receive calls directly on the watch
Enable this if your device can not show right-to-left languages
Turn on the device\'s screen when a notification arrives
Delay %s before turning the display back off after a notification
Send app notifications to the device
Deactivate this if you have trouble connecting
Send sunrise and sunset times based on the location to the Pebble timeline
Sync contact birthdays alongside calendar events
Enables calendar alerts, even when disconnected
Allow other installed 3rd party apps to set device settings through intents.
Enable this if your device has no support for your language\'s font
Enable this if your device has a custom font firmware for emoji support
Wheel diameter in inches. Typically 29, 27,5 or 26.
Enabled features for this test device
Use black background in Dark Theme
Note: for the dynamic colors theme you need to enable Wallpaper Colors or Color Palette in your Android 12+ appearance settings. If you don\'t, Gadgetbridge will use the default Material 3 colors.
Dynamic colors are not available on your device, only Android 12+ supports this functionality. Gadgetbridge will use the default Material 3 colors.
Only use network to determine location
Enable left/right swipe in the charts activity
Show RAW data on activity graph
Do not ACK activity data transfer
Force black on white color scheme
Connect to Gadgetbridge device(s) when Bluetooth is turned on
Use low-latency mode for firmware flashing
Store raw record in the database
Show a preview of the message in the title
Enable this if you want to flash a firmware not intended for your device (at your own risk)
Allow 3rd party apps to change settings
Used for the LineageOS weather provider, other Android versions need to use an app like "Weather notification". Find more information in the Gadgetbridge wiki.
Plays a tone when the earbud is touched
Get a notification when your vitality score reaches 30, 60 or 100 in the past 7 days
Get a notification when you reached the maximum number of vitality points for the day
Allow external sounds to pass through to your ears
Detect when the device is not being worn
Plays a tone when the earbud is inserted
Recognize taps between cheeks and ears
Notify when a workout is detected
Require on-watch confirmation when detecting this workout
Enable automatic detection of this workout
The amount of minutes the workout must be ongoing before detecting it
The screen will stay on during a workout, and brightness will be adjusted to continuously display real-time workout data
Keep screen on during a workout
Send the current GPS location to the band during a workout
Stop sending GPS when device does not send workout is open (milliseconds)
Start/stop fitness app tracking on phone when a GPS workout is started on the band
File logging initialization failed, writing log files is currently not available. Restart the application to attempt to initialize the log files again.
Warning: These preferences only apply to the Mi Bands 1 and 2.
Legacy settings for Q Hybrid watches
Distance is calculated from steps and step length (adjustable in Settings - About you)
Show Activity info on device card
Show current steps, distance or sleep on device card
Automatically increase the heart rate detection frequency when the band detects physical exercise, to increase heart rate capture accuracy.
Keep the band\'s display always on
Hear own voice clearly during calls
Periodical Heart Rate measurements during the day and also while asleep
Choose the items on the control center dropdown
Notification on device when disconnected from BT.
Detect double tap even when not tapped on touch pad
Use device events to trigger actions and Android broadcasts
Use your band to play your phone\'s ringtone.
Long press the button to store preset
Only if your phone supports game mode
High activity heart rate alert threshold
Vibrate the band when the heart rate is over a threshold, without any obvious physical activity in the last 10 minutes. This feature is experimental, and was not extensively tested.
The watch will beep once an hour
Heart rate alarm during sports activity
Automatically monitor heart rate variability throughout the day
Play calls through your earbuds when they are in your ears

Forces the usage of a second foreground service to keep the Notification monitor alive, activate this option if Gadgetbridge stops receiving notifications.\nPlease note that it might cause a second persistent notification to be shown.\nRestart the application after toggling.
Enable the deprecated Notification Collector Monitor Service
Allow noise control when using one earbud only
The password must have 4 digits, using only numbers
The password must have 4 digits, using numbers 1 to 4
The password must have 6 digits, using only numbers
Lock the band with a password when removed from the wrist
Vibrate the band to notify you if the stress value is higher than 80
Number of calendar events that will be synchronized
Switches the buds between paired devices automatically
Shortcut cards seen when swiping right on the watchface. When an app is running, auto-generated cards are not affected by this setting.
Specifies times when sleep is registered
Configure when the device will beep
Automatically monitor the blood oxygen levels throughout the day
Allow to send BLE characteristic read/write and connect commands
Restrict BLE Intent API communication to this package
Receive BLE connection state changes via Intents
Filter for specific BLE characteristics, split by a comma
Receive BLE characteristic changes through Intents
Allow GATT interaction through BLE Intent API
Broadcast GATT notification Intents through BLE Intent API
Enable Ambient sound and lower playback automatically after voice has been detected
The device will turn off and on automatically at the specified schedule
Allow the Wena to periodically ask Gadgetbridge to download activity data from the device
Increase the font size in calendar, notifications, etc.
Turn on the display when you look at your wrist
Adds rounded rectangles around home screen icons
Show current conditions icon in the top left corner of the home screen
The Settings icon is always shown at the end
If turned off, you will not get notified of incoming calls on the Wena
Prevent feeling of pressure in ears when not using Active Noise Cancelling
Please restart GB in order to take effect.
This feature requires the installation of a proprietary app
Use the buttons below to align the watch hands to 12:00.
Allows other Android apps to upload/overwrite files
Please set the step count to a million to activate that.
second timezone offset relative to UTC
On-device pairing confirmations can get annoying. Disabling them might lose you functionality.
use activity hand as notification counter
Watchface configuration screen for watches with firmware version DN1.0.2.19r and lower
Adjusts the sound according to the ear shape and the environment
Allow the earbuds to connect to two devices at the same time
Are you sure you want to delete the reminder?
The device has no free slots for reminders (total slots: %1$s)

string.description: Content description for the X button to clear text [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: searchview_clear_text_content_description

string.description: Content description for the navigation button to return to the previous screen [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: searchview_navigation_content_description

resources.string: You must first enable logging in the Settings - Write log files

Please keep in mind Gadgetbridge logs files that may contain lots of personal info, including but not limited to health data, unique identifiers (such as a device\'s MAC address), music preferences, etc. Consider editing the file and removing this info before sending the file to a public issue report.
Long-press volume up and down simultaneously

string.description: Title of the side sheet's accessibility pane that is spoken by TalkBack when the side sheet appears on screen. [CHAR_LIMIT=NONE]
string.name: side_sheet_accessibility_pane_title

resources.string: Unknown measurement error %d received from ring
Measurement error. Are the ring\'s sensors oriented correctly?
Use the headphones as you normally would. If the wearing condition or atmospheric pressure change, run the optimizer again.
Click to start the noise cancelling optimizer.
A description of each button mode
Pause when headphones are taken off
Turn off noise cancelling automatically when you start talking.
Warning: The equalizer, audio position and surround settings only work for the SBC audio codec.
Smart alarm interval is interval before of installed alarm. In this interval device is trying to detect lightest phase of sleep to awake user
Enable low intensity of vibration on wristband
Power saving mode turns off periodic auto measuring of heart rate thus increases working time
Adjust equalizer preset automatically based on device direction
When disconnectiong from the phone, the device will power off after the specified timeout
Hear the prompt tone when the battery level is below 20% and 10%
Set all equalizer bands back to default settings
Reduce Latency and enhance sounds of footsteps and voices. May reduce connection stability.
Enabling LDAC will decrease the battery life and might lead to connection instability
Are you sure you want to delete %d activities?
Average steps per day of the streak
Number of consecutive days with steps goal being reached
Series of consecutive days without interruption with steps goal being reached
Percentage of days with achieved goal in relation to all days with steps
Total number of steps in the whole streak
Total number of steps ever recorded
Tap connected device for App manager
Select whether device uses Celsius or Fahrenheit scale.
This is a test notification from Gadgetbridge
App must be selected to be configured
App must not be selected to be configured
Camera permission is required for this function.
Photo has been taken and saved at: %s
Camera support is required for this function.
Please enter at least one word
This setting will take effect after a reconnect
ring is charging - airplane mode NOT activated
ring is fully charged - airplane mode NOT activated
unknown error %#02x - airplane mode NOT activated
This device is already bound in Android settings, which can make pairing fail for some devices.\n\nIf adding the device fails, please remove it in Android settings and try again.
Current MTU of %1$d is too low, please enable high MTU in the device settings and disconnect/re-connect the device.
Problem with the firmware metadata transfer
Problem with the firmware transfer. DO NOT REBOOT your Mi Band!
The device does not have enough free space
The device battery is too low
About to transfer %1$s of data starting from %2$s
There was an error setting the alarms, please try again.
Full service path handling voice commands
Application that contains the service handling voice commands
Could not post ongoing notification due to missing permission
Set the time your device is showing to you right now.
When your watch vibrates, shake the device or press its button.
